qas.question: Who was a noted figure in Mosan art?
What year saw the death of Nicholas of Verdun?
On what wall of a church was the Last Judgment typically painted?
Where are narrative biblical scenes painted in the church at Saint-Savin-sur-Gartempe?
What notable Romanesque metalwork is named for Gloucester?

context: Romanesque art, especially metalwork, was at its most sophisticated in Mosan art, in which distinct artistic personalities including <a0_0>Nicholas of Verdun<a0_0/> (d. <a1_0>1205<a1_0/>) become apparent, and an almost classical style is seen in works such as a font at Liège, contrasting with the writhing animals of the exactly contemporary <a4_0>Gloucester Candlestick<a4_0/>. Large illuminated bibles and psalters were the typical forms of luxury manuscripts, and wall-painting flourished in churches, often following a scheme with a Last Judgement on the <a2_0>west<a2_0/> wall, a Christ in Majesty at the east end, and narrative biblical scenes down the nave, or in the best surviving example, at Saint-Savin-sur-Gartempe, <a3_0>on the barrel-vaulted roof<a3_0/>.
